instructions.step: Roughly chop the flesh of the mango and place into a blender or food processor. Add the contents of the can of lychees, including the syrup, lime juice and sugar.
Blitz until smooth, then pour into a jug. Transfer the mixture to an ice-cream maker and churn until frozen, then scoop into a tub, cover and store in the freezer.

Alternatively, if you donâ€™t have an ice-cream maker, pour into a freezerproof container and freeze for at least 6 hours, removing the sorbet from the freezer each hour for the first 4-5 hours to whisk it thoroughly to stop any large ice crystals forming.
Remove from the freezer 10-15 minutes before serving. The sorbet will keep in the freezer for up to three months, but is best eaten within 2 weeks for optimum flavour.
